attributes.action: Provide Sirius minerals with full Loan Guarantee from HM treasury.
attributes.background: Sirius minerals is currently building a multi billion pound fertilizer mine in Yorkshire which will boost exports and create thousands of jobs locally and nationally.  the government as of today will not fully support this project with loan guarantees.
attributes.additional_details: The government will not take a stand and guarantee the jobs for thousands of UK workers in the form of a FULL loan guarantee, all the time companies are currently making redundancies, Jaguar Land rover for instance currently set to make 4000 plus redundant. Get your priorities straight, stop squabbling about Brexit which is eroding this country and fund this project, your country needs it.

attributes.action: Ensure parliamentary privilege does not apply to deliberate misrepresentation.
attributes.background: In instances where MPs uttered comments about an individual which in a public place, rather than parliament, could lead to slander or libel charges because they were a deliberate misrepresentation, then parliamentary privilege should not apply.
attributes.additional_details: Our MP's should be held to the highest standards in public life, however they should not be permitted to make comments in the Houses of Parliament which if they were made in a public domain could lead them open the charges of slander or libel. Parliamentary privilege should not apply to deliberate misrepresentation and if a member of the public were to be misrepresented they should have the right to challenge this in a court of law, or within Parliament itself.

attributes.action: Now facts are known, allow the public to vote between no deal or remaining in EU
attributes.background: The government can not agree on a brexit agreement with the EU, and now full facts on what a No deal brexit means, the public should be allowed to make an informed vote on remaining in the EU or having a no deal Brexit

attributes.action: The UK to apply to join the Schengen Agreement
attributes.background: The Schengen Agreement guarantees border check-free travel for people within its member states. The UK should apply to join Schengen immediately to avoid travel disruption after Brexit. It's not necessary to be in the EU or EEA to join. Switzerland isn't a member of either, but is in Schengen.
attributes.additional_details: If the UK joins Schengen, there will be no more passport checks at Dover or Calais. People will be able to enter and leave the UK without any checks. This could hugely benefit the UK economy in terms of trade, open migration and tourism. It will also help the UK to develop a more humane policy towards asylum-seekers and refugees. If the UK joins Schengen, no-one will need to risk their life trying to cross the Channel by dinghy anymore.

attributes.action: Regulate fitness professional qualifications and ban fast track courses.
attributes.background: The fitness industry is suffering from underqualifed and inexperienced people masquerading as “professionals” due to fast track courses. We ask For a set standard for the qualification of both “fitness instructor” and “personal trainer” positions to avoid public injury and dangerous misinformation.

attributes.action: Parents who do Not Exercise their Duties, should lose their Parental Rights!
attributes.background: I want the law to change by taking parental responsibility from inactive parents, this would give ease to the 'Actual' Responsible Parents. It would prevent parents who are not involved in their children’s’ lives taking decisions whether it’s good for their welfare or not.
attributes.additional_details:
Absent Parents having Parental Responsibility, creates more pain & stress for the Active parent, making decisions difficult, such as: 
-Whether or not a child has medical treatment. 
-Child’s name change 
-Consent for a child go holiday etc.
 
Like being a single hardworking parent isn't difficult enough, Imagine having to ask a careless or abusive ex for "permission", or the stress & cost of courts, having to explain why we shouldn't need to get permission from an "Absent" (by choice) parent.

attributes.action: Make PE mandatory for a minimum of 2-hours per week in primary schools.
attributes.background: The government only supply a recommendation of 2-hours PE per week. Although some primary schools follow this, I have seen first hand that this is inconsistent across the country. Physical activity in young people has been shown to have a strong influence on physical, mental and social wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details:
So why is it still acceptable to neglect PE? - considering the current climate of health.
1. A third of children aged 2-15 are overweight or obese.
2. Children that are obese are more likely to be living with conditions like depression.  
3. More children are suffering from diagnosed stress and anxiety than ever before.

https://www.youthsporttrust.org/childrens-mental-health-week
https://www.mind.org.uk/media/2976123/how-to-improve-your-wellbeing-through-physical-activity-and-sport.pdf

attributes.action: Make it an offence to share film footage of assault with intent to humiliate.
attributes.background: Too many young people are sharing footage of fights and assaults with the intent to humiliate the innocent victims.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the UK government to make it illegal to share film footage on social media or via phone to phone where the intent is to humiliate the victim. An example being the young innocent girl who was seriously assaulted and then the footage was shared with the intent to cause her further distress.

attributes.action: Reinstate the Senior care worker on the job shortage list (Tier 2 visa General)
attributes.background: All care sectors across the UK, have benefited from staffing through Senior care workers being on job shortage list (Tier 2 General). Since the removal of this profession from the list it has been increasingly difficult for employers to find staff to work  senior care job roles.
attributes.additional_details: Care settings such as NHS, private residential homecare, nursing homes and domiciliary care have all benefited for this profession being on the job shortage list.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum on our EU membership, but this time including the Euro
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU referendum, there were 2 choices: Leave or Remain. We had our say. But there is a third-way: let's call it Re-Join. No more opt-outs. No more pound, even. Proper EU membership, like Germany and France. Are we so sure we want to leave, versus just joining up properly like the rest?
attributes.additional_details: The past two years have seen plenty of surprises with respect to the EU, some unpleasant. But like the turkeys who don't vote for Christmas, nobody in Westminster is offering us the one EU choice that might actually be worth considering: full membership, including the Euro. It could be our country's best bet, though. No more pound, yes. But no need for one, if our banks are built not to need bailing out in the first place. As for jobs, let's just say the sucking sound would be in our direction.

attributes.action: Make it law for all road users who do not indicate when turning, to pay a fine.
attributes.background:
I'm getting sick & tired of inconsiderate road users, whether they are operating a car, van, truck, motorcycle or bicycle. 
How many times have you sat at a busy junction & thought "if only this car wasn't coming across my path, I'd be able to get across". Only for them to turn without indicating!

attributes.action: Change age limit for large engine cars as it is for motorbikes
attributes.background: I want it changed as is for motorbikes so young people can not drive cars above a 1.2 engine till they are 25 so can help reduce risk of fatal or life changing injures
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was in car crash with young lad at wheel in large engine car and crashed car ended up on roof and she was injured two broken ankles deep cut to leg and now has too have two surgery

attributes.action: Large donations to political parties validated by the Electoral Commission
attributes.background:
At present each political party validates large donations to their party. The Electoral Commission should validate and either approve or reject the donation . After validation the funds would be transferred to the party.
Make all donations and rejected donations public. Apply one set of rules.

attributes.action: Require weekly nature protection classes in schools
attributes.background: I graduated the theoretical high school Stefan Banulescu in Romania. The high school at that time  owned the GREEN FLAG provided by the European Inspectors who mattered with that high school.
attributes.additional_details: I would like environmental protection classes aim at cleaning parks, gardening, proper care of plants and animals. Excursions to the zoo, proximity to the natural environment that is existential to be saved, and many other innovative things that can be brought into discussion in some projects.

attributes.action: Fund 12yr olds to visit Menin Gate &15yr olds to visit Auschwitz and Birkenau.
attributes.background: The rise of anti Semitism & apparent devaluing of the armed forces & their role in maintaining our democracy, there are lessons to be learnt by young people ACTUALLY seeing the scale of the horror & to establish a connection between them & the sacrifice and values that helped create modern Britain.
attributes.additional_details: I learned about World Wars at school and read about Hitler and the Nazis subsequently. I visited the Meningate and war graves in France and Belgium and paid my respects. But I did not envisage the profound reaction that a recent visit to Auschwitz and Birkenau had on my husband, friends and me. The industrial scale of the genocide was evident before our eyes. Lectures and books cannot fully capture the scale. The past MUST not be forgotten.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Hair dye to the public.
attributes.background: According to the BBC 33% of the public that dye there hair at home have some form of reaction, Many of this 33% have had a terrible reaction leading them into hospital and seeking expert advice. The public some into salons for hair colourist to fix there problem which can be a very long process.
attributes.additional_details: I push that the sale of hair dye should be prohibited, This will decrease the % of people having a reaction to hair dye. Hairdressers always preform a patch test to check if someone is allergic to the main chemical ingredients of hair dye. I ask that hair dye is strictly available for professionals only who hold the relevant qualification.

attributes.action: Exempt Start-Up Businesses from the SME R&D Tax Credit Payment PAYE Restriction.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain looks to lead the world in technological innovation, for many start-up businesses, the SME R&D Tax Credit payment provides a vital source of cashflow.  Companies that are carrying out genuine R&D should not be penalised for being unable to afford to hire permanent staff.

attributes.action: Enforce companies to label products and packaging with decomposition dates.
attributes.background: I am just an ordinary person who wants to help save our planet from drowning in plastic. If every item and its packaging were labelled with a date showing how much time they would take to decompose, then companies would be forced to re-evaluate their products and packaging.
attributes.additional_details: Labelling goods and packaging with decomposition dates would also increase awareness in society and people would make informed environmental choices when buying items. There is plastic everywhere. Take a walk around your local supermarket, or any other shop and observe the masses of plastic that is literally everywhere. Some normal plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose. A plastic bottle can take up to 450 years or more. If the government agreed to decomposition date labels on all goods and packaging, it would be a step in the right direction.

attributes.action: Consistently implement the Metric System across the UK
attributes.background: The Metric system has only been partially integrated into public life. We measure fuel in litres, speed in mph. Government policy is beer is sold in pints, while other alcohol such as spirits & wine to be sold in litres & ml. The government should implement the metric system in all law & regulation.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrepancy in selling of alcohol:
https://www.gov.uk/weights-measures-and-packaging-the-law/specified-quantities

Examples (as recent as 2000 in the UK) of where conversion errors have caused issues with infrastructure and technology:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-27509559

Inconsistency in non metric measurements - the difference between UK and US Imperial measurements:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/skillswise/factsheet/ma21impe-l1-f-converting-imperial-and-metric

attributes.action: UK to impose sanctions on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: The world is in shock of the brutality of Saudi Arabia's politicians!

attributes.action: All consumables, must by law have a biodegradable time scale stated them.
attributes.background: If for example "Bio 1mo" or "Bio 600yr" had to be printed or stamped on consumables by law.  Making consumers see how long their item will take to biodegrade may make ppl think twice. Biodegradable is a misinterpreted word, by stating actual time scales consumers can make an informed decision.
attributes.additional_details: We are killing our planet, slowly suffocating it. People still do not like to be told what to do, by putting the ball back in their hands, letting them make the choice by actually seeing what effect their lifestyle has in real time may make ppl think more and make better chioces.

attributes.action: Public inquiry into Barnsley Local Authority Social Services
attributes.background: A Judge seriously criticised Barnsley Local Authority Social Services  for their heavy-handed tactics whilst conducting safeguarding investigations into a vulnerable child who talked about “wanting to kill herself to be with her mum” who had committed suicide.
attributes.additional_details: The actions of Barnsley Social Services have also been criticised by others and should be subject to a public inquiry.

attributes.action: Let people 17 and over get tattoos with parental consent
attributes.background: This petition is to let people get tattoos at the age of 17 with parental consent. Some people get tattoos when drunk. This would not be the case if it was made so that 17 year olds needed parental consent. They wouldn't be drunk with their parents so I think it would be perfectly reasonable.

attributes.action: End Equal Opportunities Question about your race when applying for jobs
attributes.background: When applying for a job vacancies in the UK the employer always state that they are an equal opportunity employer and  you are required to state your ethnic minority group. Now this give the employer the opertunity discriminate against prospective employees the election  process.
attributes.additional_details: People from ethnic minority groups are being discriminate against whilst applying for job vacancy online In the pre selection process by employer. The question about stating what ethnic minority group you are from should be omitted from online application forms all together. If you are applying for a job that you are qualified for the question about your race shouldn't be of importance to the employer for selection. I applied for the same job with the same details but change my race from one to next and recieve a call the following day.

attributes.action: Make both GCSE English papers optional
attributes.background: I want to the government to remove English from the compulsory or “core” subjects. This is due to the fact that analysis of poems and a 400 year old play will never benefit most people in the working world. In the modern world STEM subjects are much more important and English is irrelevant.

attributes.action: all children to attend the school nearest to their home address
attributes.background: Remove parental choice of school - You only have to travel in commuter time in school holidays vs other dates to know how much congestion and pollution,and  along with wasted man hours and traffic collisions are caused by children having to commute to their parents' chosen schools.
attributes.additional_details:
What a waste of time and valuable growing up, as well as the safety risks.

Parents would be better off spending their time energy and money on helping to improve their local school rather than selfishly encouraging their children to attend 'better' ones further away.

attributes.action: Give prisoners the right to vote
attributes.background: Prisoners are humans. 93000 prisoners and further families are affected each year. Prisoners have human rights that should not be affected when committing a crime, especially if it is minor. This is what democracy is, should we really be denying the political right to vote.

attributes.action: Enable recall of local councillors who bring their role into disrepute.
attributes.background: At present there is no legal means to enable electors to recall local councillors, and the incumbent cannot be compelled to resign by their present or former parties.

attributes.action: Regulate the wedding industry to protect couples against unscrupulous suppliers
attributes.background: The wedding industry is made up of mainly self-employed suppliers. With no regulation anyone can set up a wedding related business and start taking unsuspecting couples’ money.
attributes.additional_details: You only need to look at Facebook wedding groups to see the large amount of suppliers in any one field. Too many stories of brides to be let down or conned out of money by unscrupulous conmen. As an example, anyone can buy a camera and claim to be a wedding photographer with no training or understanding of photography, or brides who think it's acceptable to ask photographers if they would like to do the job for free. We need a regulatory body which would put these issues to rest.

attributes.action: 30 hours free child care to all full time working parents from the age of 1.
attributes.background: All full time working parents should be allowed to send their children to nursery from the age of 1. This would help and encourage woman to go back to their full time work. It will reduce benefits amounts  given from councils and help full time working parents.
attributes.additional_details:
A lot of woman can not go back to work as they fear for their children care, and simply a lot of people struggle financially as they can not afford full time nursery. 
I strongly believe that full time working parents should get priority to send their children to nursery for free from the age of 1. It will encourage people and reduce the amount of benefits taken.

attributes.action: Reduce the 0.7% GDP target for Foreign Aid to 0.5% and increase NHS spending
attributes.background: Consultation with the average citizen would know doubt raise numerous stories of concern. A greater financial injection would be very beneficial and help address many issues e.g. GP Waiting times, A and E pressures, lack of funds for research, especially for childhood diseases and cancer treatment.
attributes.additional_details: Ask the people of the UK: Should more money be spent on the NHS and less on overseas aid? The answer would no doubt be 'Yes'.

attributes.action: Give employees the right to sue employers for health and safety breaches
attributes.background: We must return to the earlier system to ensure that employees have the right to sue their employer for health and safety breaches or injuries.
attributes.additional_details: Section 47 of the HASAWA 1974 restrict employee from taking civil proceedings against employer for failure to comply with the health and safety law. This is against the spirit of the health and safety legislation and natural justice. It is also not compatible with access to justice under Human Rights Act 1998.

attributes.action: Financially help grandparents who are childcare providers
attributes.background: Grandparents who step in and help out, often having their retirement revolving around our children, need to see some improvements and help financially.
attributes.additional_details: I believe we all have the right to work and to live comfortably. Grandparents are struggling enough with poverty due to their non payment of retirement and it’s about time they had some financial support for everything they do.

attributes.action: Give student hospital staff free parking permits
attributes.background: Many student nurses and student hospital staff reported cars being scratched, tyres let down and in some cases completely slashed when parked in residential areas due to not being able to afford parking at hospitals.

attributes.action: Combat ‘fake news’ by introducing critical thinking to citizenship studies.
attributes.background: Politics and the media affect every citizen in the United Kingdom. However, the link between the two is poorly taught. Critical analysis of media sources is not a core component of citizenship studies. For our students to mature into well-informed voters, these critical skills must be introduced.
attributes.additional_details: I propose that critical thinking be introduced to the KS 3-4 citizenship curriculum. In addition to understanding the UK’s political structure, it is crucial for students to be educated about the validity of media sources and media bias. These skills will become increasingly important in a digital world. In particular, these skills would help combat the destructive phenomenon of ‘fake news’. As such, critical analysis should be a compulsory component of the core curriculum.

attributes.action: Make income tax a standard 20%, regardless of how much you earn.
attributes.background: As it is now the more you earn the more tax you pay so if you're lucky enough to be earning £40k a year the government take about 5k in income tax, 5k in national insurance not even including student loans and pension contributions. The amount you take home does not reflect the work you do.

attributes.action: To make selling alcohol after 10:00 PM illegal.
attributes.background: This will be helpful because then there would be less drunk people around midnight and people that would be travelling would feel safer.

attributes.action: Guarantee the future of Southport & Formby A&E services.
attributes.background: I have heard that the Government may be considering closing or downgrading A&E at S’Port & Formby Hospital. The A&E is a vital needed service; it has saved my life more than once
attributes.additional_details:
Southport is a tourist area with many visitors from around the country. The floral hall also hosts many comedians and shows and this invites more than holiday makers. The nearest hospitals are 15-20miles away approximately adding at least 35 minutes to a journey. Not only is this vital minutes in an emergency, it’s also travelling times for families and friends to visit.
 
The information this petition is based on a flyer from my MP. We had had no notice from elsewhere.

attributes.action: Schools should start a period late on Monday mornings to take the edge off them.
attributes.background: I strongly believe that to ease children into the week, schools should start at around 9:30am on Monday mornings because teenagers are too tired and this will make it easier on them and lead to increased productivity.
attributes.additional_details: There is a similar petition going on currently saying school should start at 10am every day - personally, I think that is a bad idea as either students would leave school much later and will get home much later which may not be a good idea because they may have a very long journey or have a large pile of homework that day. Also, the staff would have to completely change their days around in terms of their personal lives (childcare, events etc) which is why I think my idea is quite realistic.

attributes.action: Stop the process of the European Union (Withdrawal) (No. 3) Bill 2017-19.
attributes.background: A Bill currently on the second reading stage in Parliament has been set out to force the government to seek an extenstion on Article 50, if a deal is not agreed in Parliament. I believe that this will not help things with brexit causing a lot more devision accross the country.
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see this Bill scrapped in the House of Commons as this hinders the vote of the British people.

attributes.action: Urge international effort to move orphans from Idlib to safety, within 3 months!
attributes.background: Children are dying freezing, hungry, orphaned. This is a international disgrace and a blight on the conscious of all humanity!

attributes.action: Put a limit on the amount of homework students can be given in a week.
attributes.background: The reason to this is that the amount of homework given to students at the moment is reducing time that could be spent on something productive such as clubs. Also a lot of people spend more time on homework than they would outside in their own time.

attributes.action: Lowering the voting age in referendums to 16
attributes.background: As some feel teenagers aren’t mature enough to vote in general elections, I feel as referendums such as Brexit ultimately affect the lives of young people, we should be allowed to have a say, as it defines our future.

attributes.action: An extra £1 taken from every tax payer to go directly toward local NHS services.
attributes.background: Many people are concerned by privatisation of NHS services. As a preventative measure, each tax paying adult is to give an extra £1 per month from their main source of income, which will go directly towards funding local NHS services.

attributes.action: Change law so a caring original owner can reclaim their dog
attributes.background: I was made homeless 4 years ago and was placed in bed and breakfast so I couldn’t take my dog with me. We had him two years from a puppy. So I found a friend who was willing to look after him till I got my home. I was paying for my boys expenses and food only for him to sell him.
attributes.additional_details: The police told me that he was looked after and being fed there’s nothing I could do. Last week I saw a video of my boy at the local kennels immediately made contact. I told them I’m going to do whatever it take to bring him home, They let me go see him. They told me yes he’s my dog he’s in my name still. But he’s been there over 7 days so he’s no longer mine. He’s not allowed home and he’s got a new family. The law should allow people like me to reclaim their pets.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum annual leave entitlement from 5.6 weeks to 7.6 weeks.
attributes.background:
The increasing retirement age leaves far less to look forward to at the end of our working lives. We are asking for increased minimum annual leave entitlements during our working lives to compensate for this loss.

This will give us more time with our families and to follow our own interests.
attributes.additional_details:
Retirement age is increasing (currently 67). Estimates are that when today's teenagers retire, the retirement age will be 75. People currently look forward to retirement but with increasing age there are fewer possibilities for those years.

Give us extra leave during our working years so that we can feel that we have lives and interests beyond work. It will reduce stress and exhaustion as well as increase happiness.

We will benefit, our children will benefit, our employers will benefit.

attributes.action: Give leave to remain to Commonwealth Citizens and HM Forces service personnel
attributes.background: Give all commonwealth citizens and HM Forces service personnel the indefinite right to live in the UK. We owe an allegiance to the United Kingdom and Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth the Second regardless of our nationality.
attributes.additional_details: Regular or Reserve, Serving or Ex-Service personnel should be protected, especially citizens of the Commonwealth serving in HM Forces. Parliament should pass a law that protect all service members of all branches of the British Forces, regular and reserve. We're not just a number.

attributes.action: Change minimum legal age of marriage in England and Wales to 18
attributes.background:
It's actually so ridiculous that 16 year olds can get married at age 16 with parental permission. 
Just don't think it's right.
attributes.additional_details: What did you do when you were 16 that you regret? Hopefully nothing that legally bound you!

attributes.action: International marriage legal right to be with family wives husbands and children
attributes.background: Even people who’ve been married for years can have to wait months or even years for a settlement visa. The Home Office never gets back to you and can keep you on hold for months or years at a time.
attributes.additional_details: There should be an automatic legal right for the partners and children of British citizens to live with them in the UK, without the ridiculous prices of visas, travel costs and time spent waiting for an outcome.

attributes.action: Outlaw all Premium and Higher rate telephone charges for mobiles and landlines.
attributes.background: Not all numbers are classified as Premium rates yet incur extortionate charges. Some Premium calls are regulated but some are not. The most vulnerable in society incur these charges. The proposal therefore is that all these telephone numbers, whether presently regulated or not are outlawed.
